trans-unit.source: Describes a color in terms of alpha, red, green, and blue channels.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*predefinedColor*
One of the colors predefined by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Colors> class.
*rgb*
A three-digit hexadecimal number.

The first digit specifies the color's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A> value, the second digit specifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A> value, and the third digit specifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A> value.
For example, `00F`.
*argb*
A four-digit hexadecimal number.

The first digit specifies the color's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A> value, the second digit specifies its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A> value, the next digit specifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A> value, and the final digit specifies its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A> value.
For example, `F00F`.
*rrggbb*
A six-digit hexadecimal number.

The first two digits specify the color's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A> value, the next two specify its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A> value, and the final two specify its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A> value.
For example, `0000FF`.
*aarrggbb*
An eight-digit hexadecimal number.

The first two digits specify the color's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A> value, the next two specify its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A> value, the next two specify its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A> value, and the final two specify its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A> value.
For example, `FF0000FF`.
*scA*
The color's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A> value.
*scR*
The color's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A> value.
*scG*
The color's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A> value.
*scB*
The color's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A> value.
*profileUri*
The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icc](~/includes/tlasharptla-icc-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icm](~/includes/tlasharptla-icm-md.md)] color profile.
*alphaValue*
The alpha channel color value.
The value range is 0.0 to 1.0.
*colorValue*
A comma-delimited list of three to eight values that represent the color channels of the color profile.
The value range is 0.0 to 1.0.
Gets or sets the `sRGB` alpha channel value of the color.
The alpha channel of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure determines the amount of transparency the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> has.
An alpha value of 255 indicates the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> is completely opaque and a value of 0 indicates the color is completely transparent.

The `sRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A>) and the ScRGB channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A>) of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure are synchronized properties.

For example, when <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A>, the `sRGB` alpha channel, is modified, the `ScRGB` alpha channel, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A>, is converted to the equivalent value using the 0-1 range that the `Sc` scheme supports.
The `sRGB` alpha channel value of the color, a value between 0 and 255.
Adds two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structures.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structures are added together by adding the alpha, red, green, and blue channels of the first color to the alpha, red, green, and blue channels of the second color.
For example, the alpha channel of `color1` and the alpha channel of `color2` are added together to produce the alpha channel of the resulting color.
The same is done with the red, green, and blue channels to produce the red, green, and blue channels of the new color.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to add.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to add.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure whose color values are the results of the addition operation.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structures for fuzzy equality.
This equality method compensates for the fact that floating-point values can acquire a small amount of error when operated upon.
The first color to compare.
The second color to compare.
`true` if color1 and color2 are nearly identical; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the `sRGB` blue channel value of the color.

The `sRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A>) and the `ScRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A>) of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure are synchronized properties.

For example, when <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A>, the `sRGB` blue channel, is modified, the `ScRGB` blue channel, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A>, is converted to the equivalent value using the 0-1 range that the `Sc` scheme supports.
The `sRGB` blue channel value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure, a value between 0 and 255.
Sets the `ScRGB` channels of the color to within the gamut of 0 to 1, if they are outside that range.
The gamut of the `ScRGB` color space is larger than the clamp range, so the use of this method may result in the loss of color information.
Gets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icc](~/includes/tlasharptla-icc-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icm](~/includes/tlasharptla-icm-md.md)] color profile of the color.

A [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icc](~/includes/tlasharptla-icc-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icm](~/includes/tlasharptla-icm-md.md)] color profile contains a color system profile for a particular application or device such as a color printer.
This profile is matched to a common profile that in turn can be mapped to the individual profiles of other devices.
This allows the color system used by one computer device to match the colors from other applications and devices on the same or other computer systems.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icc](~/includes/tlasharptla-icc-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icm](~/includes/tlasharptla-icm-md.md)] color profile of the color.
Tests whether the specified object is a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure and is equivalent to this color.
Floating-point values can acquire a small degree of error when they are operated upon.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.Equals%2A> method, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.op_Equality%2A> operator, and the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.op_Inequality%2A> operator do not compensate for this and thus may not return the expected Boolean result.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.AreClose%2A> method uses a fuzzy equality algorithm that compensates for this floating-point arithmetic error by returning `true` for a comparison of two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structures that are practically identical, but whose values may differ by a minuscule amount.
The object to compare to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure.

`true` if the specified object is a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure and is identical to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure; otherwise, `false`.
Tests whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure is identical to this color.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to compare to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure is identical to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure; otherwise, `false`.
Tests whether two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structures are identical.
Floating-point values can acquire a small degree of error when they are operated upon.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.Equals%2A> method, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.op_Equality%2A> operator, and the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.op_Inequality%2A> operator do not compensate for this and thus may not return the expected Boolean result.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.AreClose%2A> method uses a fuzzy equality algorithm that compensates for this floating-point arithmetic error by returning `true` for a comparison of two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structures that are practically identical, but whose values may differ by a minuscule amount.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to compare.
`true` if color1 and color2 are exactly identical; otherwise, `false`.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure by using the specified `sRGB` alpha channel and color channel values.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.FromArgb%2A> method allows you to specify the alpha channel; the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.FromRgb%2A> method uses a default value of 255 for the alpha channel.
The alpha channel of a color determines the amount of transparency of the color.
An alpha value of 255 indicates that the color is completely opaque, and a value of 0 indicates that the color is completely transparent.
The alpha channel, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color.A"></xref>, of the new color.
The red channel, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color.R"></xref>, of the new color.
The green channel, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color.G"></xref>, of the new color.
The blue channel, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color.B"></xref>, of the new color.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure with the specified values.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure by using the specified alpha channel, color channel values, and color profile.

A [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icc](~/includes/tlasharptla-icc-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icm](~/includes/tlasharptla-icm-md.md)] color profile contains a color system profile for a particular application or device such as a color printer.
This profile is matched to a common profile that in turn can be mapped to the individual profiles of other devices.
This allows the color system used by one computer device to match the colors from other applications and devices on the same or other computer systems.
The alpha channel for the new color,a value between 0 and 1.
A collection of values that specify the color channels for the new color.
These values map to the profileUri.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icc](~/includes/tlasharptla-icc-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icm](~/includes/tlasharptla-icm-md.md)] color profile for the new color.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure with the specified values.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure by using the specified `sRGB` color channel values.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.FromArgb%2A> method allows you to specify the alpha channel; the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.FromRgb%2A> method uses a default value of 1 for the alpha channel.
The alpha channel of a color determines the amount of transparency of the color.
An alpha value of 1 indicates that the color is completely opaque, and a value of 0 indicates that the color is completely transparent.

The sRGB channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A>) and the ScRGB channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A>) of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure are synchronized properties.
For example, when <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, the sRGB red channel, is modified the ScRGB red channel, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, is transformed to the equivalent value.
The `sRGB` red channel, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color.R"></xref>, of the new color.
The `sRGB` green channel, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color.G"></xref>, of the new color.
The `sRGB` blue channel, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color.B"></xref>, of the new color.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure with the specified values and an alpha channel value of 255.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure by using the specified `ScRGB` alpha channel and color channel values.
The alpha channel of a color determines the amount of transparency of the color.
An alpha value of 1 indicates that the color is completely opaque, and a value of 0 indicates that the color is completely transparent.
The `ScRGB` alpha channel, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA"></xref>, of the new color.
The `ScRGB` red channel, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR"></xref>, of the new color.
The `ScRGB` green channel, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG"></xref>, of the new color.
The `ScRGB` blue channel, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB"></xref>, of the new color.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure with the specified values.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure by using the specified color channel values and color profile.

A [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icc](~/includes/tlasharptla-icc-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icm](~/includes/tlasharptla-icm-md.md)] color profile contains a color system profile for a particular application or device such as a color printer.
This profile is matched to a common profile that in turn can be mapped to the individual profiles of other devices.
This allows the color system used by one computer device to match the colors from other applications and devices on the same or other computer systems.
A collection of values that specify the color channels for the new color.
These values map to the profileUri.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icc](~/includes/tlasharptla-icc-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_icm](~/includes/tlasharptla-icm-md.md)] color profile for the new color.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure with the specified values and an alpha channel value of 1.
Gets or sets the `sRGB` green channel value of the color.

The `sRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A>) and the `ScRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A>) of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure are synchronized properties.

For example, when <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A>, the `sRGB` green channel, is modified, the `ScRGB` green channel, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A>, is converted to the equivalent value using the 0-1 range that the `Sc` scheme supports.
The `sRGB` green channel value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure, a value between 0 and 255.
Gets a hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure.
A hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure.
Gets the color channel values of the color.
An array of color channel values.
Multiplies the alpha, red, blue, and green channels of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure by the specified value.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> to be multiplied.
The value to multiply by.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure whose color values are the results of the multiplication operation.
Adds two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structures.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structures are added together by adding the alpha, red, green, and blue channels of the first color to the alpha, red, green, and blue channels of the second color.
For example, the alpha channel of `color1` and the alpha channel of `color2` are added together to produce the alpha channel of the resulting color.
The same is done with the red, green, and blue channels to produce the red, green, and blue channels of the new color.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.Add%28System.Windows.Media.Color%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Color%29?displayProperty=fullName>
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to add.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to add.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure whose color values are the results of the addition operation.
Tests whether two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structures are identical.
Floating-point values can acquire a small degree of error when they are operated upon.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.Equals%2A> method, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.op_Equality%2A> operator, and the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.op_Inequality%2A> operator do not compensate for this and thus may not return the expected Boolean result.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.AreClose%2A> method uses a fuzzy equality algorithm that compensates for this floating-point arithmetic error by returning `true` for a comparison of two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structures that are practically identical, but whose values may differ by a minuscule amount.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.Equals%28System.Windows.Media.Color%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Color%29?displayProperty=fullName>
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to compare.
`true` if color1 and color2 are exactly identical; otherwise, `false`.
Tests whether two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structures are not identical.
Floating-point values can acquire a small degree of error when they are operated upon.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.Equals%2A> method, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.op_Equality%2A> operator, and the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.op_Inequality%2A> operator do not compensate for this and thus may not return the expected Boolean result.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.AreClose%2A> method uses a fuzzy equality algorithm that compensates for this floating-point arithmetic error by returning `true` for a comparison of two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structures that are practically identical, but whose values may differ by a minuscule amount.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.Equals%28System.Windows.Media.Color%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Color%29?displayProperty=fullName>
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to compare.
`true` if color1 and color2 are not equal; otherwise, `false`.
Multiplies the alpha, red, blue, and green channels of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure by the specified value.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.Multiply%28System.Windows.Media.Color%2CSystem.Single%29?displayProperty=fullName>
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> to be multiplied.
The value to multiply by.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure whose color values are the results of the multiplication operation.
Subtracts a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure from a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structures are subtracted from one another by subtracting the alpha, red, green, and blue channels of the second color from the alpha, red, green, and blue channels of the first color.
For example, the alpha channel of `color2` is subtracted from the alpha channel of `color1` to produce the alpha channel of the resulting <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure.
The same is done with the red, green, and blue channels to produce the red, green, and blue channels of the new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.Subtract%28System.Windows.Media.Color%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Color%29?displayProperty=fullName>
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to be subtracted from.
The structure to subtract from color1.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure whose color values are the results of the subtraction operation.
Gets or sets the `sRGB` red channel value of the color.

The `sRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A>) and the `ScRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A>) of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure are synchronized properties.

For example, when <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, the `sRGB` red channel, is modified, the `ScRGB` red channel, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, is converted to the equivalent value using the 0-1 range that the `Sc` scheme supports.
The `sRGB` red channel value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure, a value between 0 and 255.
Gets or sets the `ScRGB` alpha channel value of the color.
The alpha channel of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure determines the amount of transparency the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> has.
An alpha value of 1 indicates the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> is completely opaque and a value of 0 indicates the color is completely transparent.

The `sRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A>) and the `ScRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A>) of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure are synchronized properties.

For example, when <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A>, the `sRGB` alpha channel, is modified, the `ScRGB` alpha channel, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A>is converted to the equivalent value using the 0-1 range that the `Sc` scheme supports.
The `ScRGB` alpha channel value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure, a value between 0 and 1.
Gets or sets the ScRGB blue channel value of the color.

The `sRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A>) and the `ScRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A>) of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure are synchronized properties.

For example, when <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A>, the `sRGB` blue channel, is modified, the `ScRGB` blue channel, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A>, is converted to the equivalent value using the 0-1 range that the `Sc` scheme supports.
The ScRGB red channel value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure, a value between 0 and 1.
Gets or sets the `ScRGB` green channel value of the color.

The `sRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A>) and the `ScRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A>) of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure are synchronized properties.

For example, when <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A>, the `sRGB` green channel, is modified, the `ScRGB` green channel, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A>is converted to the equivalent value using the 0-1 range that the `Sc` scheme supports.
The `ScRGB` green channel value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure, a value between 0 and 1.
Gets or sets the `ScRGB` red channel value of the color.

The `sRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.A%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.G%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.B%2A>) and the `ScRGB` channels (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScA%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScG%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScB%2A>) of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure are synchronized properties.

For example, when <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.R%2A>, the `sRGB` red channel, is modified, the `ScRGB` red channel, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color.ScR%2A>, is converted to the equivalent value using the 0-1 range that the `Sc` scheme supports.
The `ScRGB` red channel value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure, a value between 0 and 1.
Subtracts a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure from a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structures are subtracted from one another by subtracting the alpha, red, green, and blue channels of the second color from the alpha, red, green, and blue channels of the first color.
For example, the alpha channel of `color2` is subtracted from the alpha channel of `color1` to produce the alpha channel of the resulting <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure.
The same is done with the red, green, and blue channels to produce the red, green, and blue channels of the new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Color> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure to be subtracted from.
The structure to subtract from color1.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure whose color values are the results of the subtraction operation.
Creates a string representation of the color using the `sRGB` channels.
The string representation of the color.
The default implementation represents the values in hex form, prefixes with the # character, and starts with the alpha channel.
For example, the value for is #FFF0F8FF.
Creates a string representation of the color by using the `sRGB` channels and the specified format provider.
Culture-specific formatting information.
The string representation of the color.
Formats the value of the current instance using the specified format.
The format to use.
-or-
A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref href="System.IFormattable"></xref> implementation.
The provider to use to format the value.
-or-
A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
The value of the current instance in the specified format.
